item.title: 对冲基金回报率达 50%，抨击韩国企业虚伪
item.description: 一家韩国对冲基金今年迄今为止的回报率高达 50%，跑赢了韩国低迷的股市，该基金在股东回报问题上大骂矿商 Young Poong 公司虚伪。【原文：A Korean hedge fund that has outperformed the nation’s sluggish stocks with a 50% return so far this year is calling out hypocrisy at miner Young Poong Corp. over shareholder returns.】

item.title: 日本生命 120 亿美元的收购狂潮才刚刚开始
item.description: 日本生命保险公司仅在本月就完成了超过 120 亿美元的交易。日本最大的保险公司还没有完成交易。【原文：Nippon Life Insurance Co. has done more than $12 billion of deals this month alone. Japan’s biggest insurer isn’t finished yet.】

item.title: 美元走强，全球基金从新兴市场转向美国股市
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 中国投资者通过领汇买入创纪录数量的香港股票
item.description: 在动物精神复苏和人民币走软的背景下，中国内地投资者加大了对香港风险资产的投资，抢购了创纪录数量的香港股票。【原文：Mainland Chinese investors snapped up a record amount of Hong Kong stocks as they ramped up exposure to risk assets in the city amid a revival of animal spirits and a weakening yuan.】

item.title: 上田的谨慎态度令日元面临日本央行政策逻辑漏洞的风险
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫新发现的谨慎态度以及由此引发的日元再次走软，有可能会破坏他根据经济发展情况保持政策正常化的竞选逻辑。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda’s newfound caution and the renewed yen weakness it has sparked risks damaging the logic of his campaign to keep normalizing policy in line with developments in the economy.】

item.title: 日本债券市场将吸收十年来最大的供应量
item.description: 由于日本央行计划缩减资产负债表，投资者将面临至少十年来最大规模的日本主权债券供应，这将加重债务人因利率上升而面临的困境。【原文：Investors are set to face the largest supply of Japanese sovereign bonds in at least a decade as the central bank plans to shrink its balance sheet, adding to debtholders’ woes from rising interest rates.】

item.title: 市场权衡美国利率前景，黄金保持稳定
item.description: 上周，美联储首选的基本通胀指标低于预期，交易商对货币政策前景进行了权衡，黄金因此持稳。【原文：Gold was steady as traders weighed the outlook for monetary policy after the Federal Reserve’s preferred measure of underlying inflation came in below expectations last week.】

item.title: 美联储和日本央行迅速缩小利率差距的希望破灭，日元多头退却
item.description: 在美联储和日本央行召开政策会议之后，交易员们正在减少对日元反弹的押注，因为他们对美国和日本之间的利率差缩小的速度产生了怀疑。【原文：Traders are trimming their bets on a yen rally after policy meetings from the Federal Reserve and Bank of Japan cast doubts on how quickly the rate differentials between the US and Japan may narrow.】

item.title: 交易员关注特朗普威胁，石油在周度下跌后企稳
item.description: 在经历了一周的下跌之后，石油市场趋于稳定，因为交易商们正在评估美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普重新控制巴拿马运河的威胁。【原文：Oil steadied after a weekly decline as traders gauged President-elect Donald Trump’s threat to reimpose US control over the Panama Canal.】

item.title: 特朗普回国后，澳大利亚将推迟新的气候目标
item.description: 由于唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）重返白宫，澳大利亚到 2035 年减少碳排放的新目标预计将被推迟数月，很可能会推迟到 5 月举行的下届大选之后。【原文：Australia’s new targets for carbon emission cuts by 2035 are expected to be delayed by several months as a result of Donald Trump’s return to the White House, likely pushing them out beyond the next election which is due to be held by May.】

item.title: 市场综述：美国忧虑缓解，亚洲股市谨慎上涨
item.description: 上周五，美联储首选的通胀指标低于预期，周末美国政府也避免了停摆，亚洲股市将在假日清淡的交易中迎来一个谨慎积极的开端。【原文：Asian stocks are set for a cautiously positive start in holiday-thinned trading after the Federal Reserve’s preferred inflation gauge came in below expectations on Friday and a US government shutdown was averted over the weekend.】

item.title: 西非军政府拒绝推迟退出地区集团的时间
item.description: 马里、尼日尔和布基纳法索的军事领导人拒绝了一个地区贸易集团提出的将其退出时间推迟六个月的建议，这是他们避免分裂的最后一次尝试。【原文：Military leaders from Mali, Niger and Burkina Faso brushed off a proposal from a regional trade bloc to postpone their exit by six months in a final attempt to avoid its fracture.】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 随着咖啡、可可和鸡蛋价格的飙升，多变的天气和美国禽流感疫情使即将到来的节日菜单变得更加昂贵。同时，欧佩克预计，在中国、印度和其他亚洲国家的推动下，2025 年的石油需求将攀升。用电量也在增加，北美一家重要机构大幅上调了预测。此外，煤炭需求也被调高，这与早先估计煤炭使用量在去年达到顶峰的说法相反。【原文：Volatile weather and the US bird-flu outbreak are making the upcoming holiday menu more expensive as the price of coffee, cocoa and eggs soar. Meanwhile, OPEC expects oil demand to climb in 2025, driven by China, India and other Asian nations. Electricity use also is rising, with a key North American agency revising its projections significantly upward. Also revised higher is demand for coal, contrary to earlier estimates that said its use peaked last year.】

item.title: 2024 年的 11 次疯狂交易：繁荣、萧条和 2900% 的暴利
item.description:
以下是今年市场的高潮和低谷，从特朗普的胜利交易和阿根廷的意外之财，到对冲基金的破灭押注。【原文：

Here are the highs and lows of the year in markets, from triumphant Trump trades and a windfall in Argentina to busted hedge-fund bets.

】

item.title: 比特币逼近特朗普获胜后的首次周跌幅
item.description: 自唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在上个月的美国大选中获胜以来，比特币正走向首次单周下跌，原因是美联储谨慎的政策前景削弱了当选总统对加密货币行业的支持所引发的乐观情绪。【原文：Bitcoin is headed toward its first weekly decline since Donald Trump’s victory in last month’s US election as a cautious Federal Reserve policy outlook tempers optimism sparked by the president-elect’s embrace of the crypto sector.】

item.title: 金融时报》称，Palantir、Anduril 等科技集团正在寻求五角大楼的工作机会
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周日报道，Palantir 科技公司和 Anduril 工业公司正在洽谈与竞争对手合作组建一个财团，共同竞标美国政府的工作。【原文：Palantir Technologies Inc. and Anduril Industries Inc. are in talks to partner with rivals to form a consortium that would bid together for US government work, the Financial Times reported Sunday.】

item.title: 德国社民党呼吁通过反垄断法削弱埃隆-马斯克的力量
item.description: 德国总理奥拉夫-肖尔茨（Olaf Scholz）领导的社会民主党（Social Democrats）的一位资深议员抨击埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）对德国政治的干预，并呼吁制定新的反垄断法，以限制他在企业界的影响力。【原文：A senior lawmaker from Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s Social Democrats railed against Elon Musk’s interference in German politics and called for a new antitrust act to constrain his influence in the corporate world.】

item.title: 小型飞机坠入巴西城市，击中居民区
item.description: 据当地政府称，一架小型飞机在巴西南部南里奥格兰德州的格拉玛多市坠毁。该州州长爱德华多-莱特（Eduardo Leite）在 X 网站上发文称，乘客似乎都已遇难。【原文：A small airplane crashed in the Brazilian city of Gramado, in the southern Rio Grande do Sul state, according to local authorities. It appears that the passengers didn’t survive, the state’s governor, Eduardo Leite, said in a post on X.】

item.title: 国家电视台报道：普京与斯洛伐克总统菲佐在莫斯科举行会谈
item.description: 据俄罗斯国家电视台 Rossiya 24 频道报道，俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京正在莫斯科与斯洛伐克总理罗伯特-菲佐举行会谈。【原文：Russian President Vladimir Putin is holding talks with Slovakian Prime Minister Robert Fico in Moscow, state TV channel Rossiya 24 reported.】

item.title: 债券交易员在数十年来最痛苦的宽松政策中转向 2025 年
item.description: 债券交易员很少因美联储的宽松周期而遭受如此大的损失。现在，他们担心 2025 年可能会出现更多同样的情况。【原文：Bond traders have rarely suffered so much from a Federal Reserve easing cycle. Now they fear 2025 threatens more of the same.】

item.title: 在 ChatGPT 首次亮相两年后，人工智能 "马路杀手 "的担忧一直困扰着交易者
item.description: ChatGPT 的崛起引发了人们对人工智能的担忧，各种类型的企业都深受其害。聊天机器人发布两年后，其结果并没有像一些投资者预测的那样带来灾难性的影响。但焦虑情绪依然不减。【原文：The rise of ChatGPT sparked fears about artificial intelligence roiling businesses of all kinds. Two years after the chatbot’s release, the results haven’t been nearly as cataclysmic as some investors predicted. But there’s still plenty of anxiety.】

item.title: 对新兴市场而言，"明年运气会更好 "很难让人相信
item.description: 过去一年，以新兴市场为重点的投资者几乎没有什么值得庆祝的事情。过去十年也是如此。现在，唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）关税和贸易战的前景让一些人考虑完全放弃新兴市场。【原文：Emerging markets-focused investors have had little to celebrate over the past year. Or for that matter, over the past decade. Now the prospect of Donald Trump’s tariffs and trade wars has some considering abandoning them altogether.】

item.title: 法国对意大利金融业的举动引发罗马担忧
item.description: 意大利政府越来越担心法国在其金融业中的影响力增加的前景，正在进行的两笔重大交易可能会重塑意大利金融市场。【原文：The Italian government is growing concerned about the prospect of an increased French presence in its finance industry, with two major deals in the works that could potentially reshape the market.】

item.title: 研究发现：南非在经济增长数据中对农业的计算不足
item.description: 南非最大的农场工业游说团体称，对统计机构方法的调查显示，今年的农业萎缩并没有报告的那么严重，并呼吁对计算方法进行改革。【原文：South Africa’s biggest farm-industry lobby said a probe into the statistics agency’s methods showed that agriculture hadn’t contracted as much as reported this year and called for a reform of the calculations.】

item.title: 欧洲大型股票在美国巨型股票的阴影下越缩越深
item.description: 诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk A/S）股价暴跌 930 亿美元，给欧洲最大的上市公司带来了最新的打击。【原文：A $93 billion plunge in Novo Nordisk A/S shares has provided the latest blow to Europe’s largest listed companies, which have spent another year struggling in vain to match the returns of Wall Street’s biggest stocks.】

item.title: 对英国统计局调查的质疑波及国内生产总值数据
item.description: 同样的调查失败曾让英国无法确定劳动力的数量，现在又让人怀疑英国的经济规模。【原文：The same kind of survey failures that have left the UK unsure about the number of people in Britain’s workforce are now raising doubts about the size of its economy.】

item.title: 印度正迎来九十年代式的股票飙升期
item.description: 按百分比计算，20 世纪 90 年代末美国股市的繁荣仍是有史以来最大的繁荣，并帮助丰富了整整一代投资者。使这一涨势成为可能的关键因素之一正在印度生根发芽。【原文：The boom in US stocks during the late 1990s still ranks as the biggest ever in percentage terms, and helped enrich a whole generation of investors. One of the key ingredients that made the rally possible is taking root in India.】

item.title: 苹果公司的 10 亿美元投资对印尼来说可能只是短暂的胜利
item.description: 苹果公司提出将在印尼的投资额提高到 10 亿美元，以促使印尼总统普拉博沃-苏比安托（Prabowo Subianto）的政府取消 iPhone 16 的销售禁令，印尼因此取得了胜利。这一胜利可能是短暂的。【原文：Indonesia claimed victory after Apple Inc. offered to increase its investment in the country to $1 billion to get President Prabowo Subianto’s government to lift a ban on the sale of iPhone 16s. The win may be short-lived.】
